title: Ticket #5794: Implement other serialization formats for python bindings
description:
Note: this ticket has been abandoned; see #6950 instead

Now that the ClassAd library has a new serialization format (JSON-based), we should add that and the XML format to the python bindings.
remarks:
2016-Aug-15 09:58:58 by bbockelm:
It seems that TJ is also working on an universal parser (or approximation thereof) that is needed for this ticket.

I'm marking this as assigned to TJ until that piece has landed. Once in, I will pick up the remaining parts.

2016-Aug-15 10:01:01 by bbockelm:
Per private discussion with TJ:
  • Universal parser works for all cases where it can (some cases are ambiguous between the JSON and new-ClassAd formats).
  • Universal parser is callback-based, meaning that some refactoring is needed first before Python could use it (Python requires an iterator-based approach).

2019-Mar-08 16:36:02 by tannenba:
Abandoned for ticket #6950
check_ins: 2016-Jul-21 08:39   Check-in [48824]: Add support for multiple print formats. #5794 This provides a mechanism for printing in various formats (old / new / JSON / XML) and deprecates the printOld method. (By Brian Bockelman )
creator: johnkn
